title: 30 workers complete a job in 36 days. After 30 days, some workers joined and completed the job 2 days earlier. How many new workers joined? - Quora

response.answer_text: The entire work requires 30*36 = 1080 worker-days. In 30 days the work accomplished = 30*30 = 900 worker-days From 31st till 34 days some x number of additional workers joined. 900+4x = 1080, or 4x = 1080–900 = 180 x = 180/4 = 45. So 15 additional workers joined for 4 days to complete the work in 34 days. Answer.

30×36 man-days —————— 1work 30×30 man-days already expended work done =(30×30)/(30×36)=5/6 Work remaining =1–5/6=1/6 If none extra men could have joined, the work could have been completed in( 36–30) 6 days With extra men joined , work done in 4 days 6 days —— 1/6 work —— 30 men 4 days —— 1/6 work ——— (30×6)/4=45 men Therefore 45–30=15 extra men joined. Therefore 15 extra men joined. □Ans.

Let W denotes the whole amount of work required to complete the whole given job. It is mentioned that 30 workers complete W in 36 days. So we find that 1 worker in 1 day completes the amount of work = W/(30*36) It is mentioned that after 30 days, some workers joined and completed the job 2 days earlier. Let N denotes the number of new workers joined. Hence, we find that 30 workers in 30 days completed a part of W and after that N number of new workers joined and then (N + 30) workers completed the remaining part of W in 4 days (= 36 - 30 - 2). So we get the following equation, 30*30*W/(30*36) + (30 + N)*4*W/(30*36) = W or 5/6 + (30 + N)/(30*9) = 1 or 30 + N = (30*9)*(1 - 5/6) = (30*9)/6 = 45 or N = 45 -30 = 15 [Ans}

Efficiency of each worker = {1 / (30 * 36)} of job per day. Let, n number of extra workers joined after 30 days and the job was completed in 34 days. So, 30 * 30 * {1 / (30 * 36)} + (30 + n) * 4 * {1 / (30 * 36)} = 1 (5 / 6) + (30 + n) * 4 * {1 / (30 * 36)} = 1 (30 + n) * 4 * {1 / (30 * 36)} = (1 / 6) (30 + n) = {(30 * 36) / (4 * 6)} = 45 n = 15. So, the answer is 15 workers joined later.

Since 30 workers have worked for 30 days that requires 36 days, the remaining work takes 6 more days or 30 x 6 mandays. Suppose x workers join them to finish the work 2 days earlier. That is 30+x workers finish the remaining work in 4 days = (30+x)4 mandays. This implies that (30+x)4 = 30x6 => 30+x = 30x6/4 = 45 => x = 15 Number of new workers who joined = 15.
